NEWS BITES

Land Bonds Eyed as Government Solution to Hong Kong Housing Crisis In the search for solutions to Hong Kong’s housing crisis, the Hong Kong Housing Federation is asking the government to issue land bonds that would help create new housing options and address the issue of high home prices. Land bonds would allow the government to take over plots that would be suitable to build housing on and, in return, give those owners bonds that would entitle them to other pieces of land. South China Morning Post

Singapore’s Luxury Market Grows Singapore has seen an increase in luxury home sales as interest from Mainland China has grown due to government protests in Hong Kong. In the first nine months of 2019, 315 prime condo units were sold to buyers from foreign countries, one-third of whom were Mainland Chinese. There were as many SGD10 million (US$ 7.3 million) sales that have occurred in the year through September as there were in the entirety of last year. The Business Times

Justin Bieber Tries to Sell Los Angeles Home on Instagram Justin Bieber took an interesting approach to selling his Beverly Hills home. On an Instagram post that featured 12 images of the 6,100-square-foot five-bedroom, he wrote, "I think I wanna sell my home in Beverly Hills who wants it." He later posted that he would include all the furniture and implored followers to make him an offer. The home was purchased by Bieber and his wife Hailey for $8.5 million this year. New York Post

Home Price Growth in Inglewood Soars Past Los Angeles’s Average Between 2014 and 2018, home prices in Inglewood soared 63%, the most dramatic price growth in Los Angeles during that period. Over the same time, prices in all of Los Angeles grew by 25%. The median price in the area is now $485,000, which is still affordable compared to the $870,000 Los Angeles median. The addition of an NFL stadium opening next summer and a new train line are expected to cause prices to rise even more. Curbed
